intro: Galium pamphylicum, commonly known as the Pamphylian bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pale pink flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands. Galium pamphylicum is often found in open, disturbed areas and is adapted to the warm, arid climates of its native range.
